html: After their wandering in the dark and release from bondage (v 2), Jehovah’s elect return home and receive lands of inheritance. “Spoil” and “harvest time” respectively signify victory over enemies and a reinherited land. The nation of Jehovah’s people is “enlarged” when those who are abroad are welcomed by and unite with those at home (Isaiah 26:1-2; 49:12-22). Joy and rejoicing accompany their return and deliverance (Isaiah 24:14; 30:29; 51:3, 11; 55:12). Instead of cowering at Jehovah’s presence like the wicked (Isaiah 2:10, 19, 21; 64:1-3), his elect celebrate (Isaiah 12:1-6; 25:9; 35:3-6; 52:8).
